newsitem.title: FRANCE: Algeria buys Argentine, French wheat - traders.
newsitem.headline: Algeria buys Argentine, French wheat - traders.

text.p: Algeria bought an estimated 50,000 tonnes of Argentine wheat and 25,000 tonnes of French wheat at a tender, European grain traders said on Tuesday.
One trader said Algeria bought two cargoes of 25,000 tonnes of Argentine wheat at prices from $165 to $166 per tonne, including freight. The wheat is for shipment in December.
The French wheat, for shipment in the second half of November, was priced at $184 per tonne, including cost and freight, with a Coface export credit, he said.
Another source said the Argentine wheat was sold below $170 with freight. There was no official confirmation of the deals.
Algeria had tendered to import 75,000 tonnes of French and/or Argentine wheat in three lots of 25,000 tonnes each.
Word of a purchase followed confusion over the amount of French wheat Algeria has bought over the past week.
Industry sources said last week Algeria had bought 100,000 tonnes of French wheat. But trade sources later put that purchase at only 75,000 tonnes.
Then, some traders said, Algeria cancelled two cargoes, reducing last week's purchase to only 25,000 tonnes of French wheat.
